reviewText:
Its a Marble rolling game, what's there to say? You honestly ether like these or you don't for the most part.

I guess I'll give a few more details than that, the marble controls have a bit of learning curve, the marble itself has weight and you can't stop on a complete dime, for better or for worse. you can unlock anything including stages by earning orbs, meaning you can still progress if stuck on an annoying stage, the game is pretty for a marble game though most games of this type are simple graphics so thats not saying alot.

Either way if you are a marble game enthusiast theres nothing bad about this one.
voteText: 10 of 15 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nYou roll a ball to the goal while collecting orbs. Nothing else to say really. It works and its fun. If you like games like Marble Blast Ultra you'll like this.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: IntroductionYou might be asking yourself? Marble Blast Ultra, where art thou? Maybe not in those exact words, but if you are... GET OUTTA HERE SHAKESPEARE! Anyways, Marble Void is a game inspired by Marble Blast Ultra (yep, that Xbox Live Arcade title on the Xbox 360) and another title called Marble Madness (that I never played). The game adds more to the formula of the Marble genre of game, but takes away from some things too (which isn't a bad thing).\n\nThe Experience So FarI've managed to beat the Easy Difficulty levels after doing some exploration with the game. It took me about 30 minutes, but that's only if you're going about figuring out the game itself. There's a ton of potential for speed running like the past Marble titles. There's also these things called orbs" that grant you unlocks if you "bank" a certain amount. Banking orbs just happens after collecting and clearing a level
date: and each level has a certain amount of orbs to collect. The unlocks you are granted after banking are new modes
recommended: and I believe even new marbles (I have yet to see that yet though).\n\nThe reason I purchased Marble Void was to finally get my Marble Blast Ultra fix
hoursPlayed: and let me say it delivered 'marbleously' (get it?). At the beginning it had me thinking
votesHelpful: but eventually I had mixed thoughts of
votesTotal: "it might as well be" and "it's not trying to be". The game teaches you how to play the game and what the game has to offer right at the beginning of the levels. During these points of being taught the game's level design and physics you'll compare the games you've played before
votesFunny:
and think "This isn't Marble Blast Ultra or Marble Madness - this is Marble Void!"

The game has a few things that obviously need to be addressed such as:
Game speed. It feels very slow compared to the other games... However
commentsCount: the game speed also makes sense considering you're a marble in a void.\nMoving platforms can feel slow. It's not my graphic settings either that makes this seem slow
column16: I've dabbled into the "toaster" graphic setting
column17: and the moving platforms make me anxious when waiting on them.\nThe menu's aren't controller enabled. Although I like how you can bind your own controls
column18: it's only effective in-game. I'm a lazy gamer
column19: and I don't like having to press start
column20: and then use my mouse to navigate menu's.\nA respawn button would be nice instead of pressing start and clicking respawn. Again
column21: it's more a nitpick for fast gameplay.\nThe ConclusionThis is Marble Void
column22: a game where you'll be saying things like
column23: "what about Marble Blast Ultra?" in a 'who cares' manner? Marble Void does a lot better with the Marble genre
column24: but although it has it's weaknesses on pacing
column25: it's still a game where you can't deny having fun with."

reviewText: This game is AMAZING. There are so many special features that happen while you are rolling through levels it's INSANE. I really like the powerups and things like switch gravity that make the levels really amazing to navigate through. It's Pacman meets Tetris with a hint of Megaman in it! :D   5 stars from me and I normally don't care for puzzle board type games.
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Amazing game. Takes what MBG did and upgraded on it. Great visuals, rad soundtrack and overall really fun. Hard at times of course, but that's a must. Can't recommend enough to those looking for a little nostalgia. And a lot of fun for people new to the genre aswell!
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText: There's physics-enabled blocks, completely customizable marbles, an in-game level editor, an endless mode, and an in-game currency without microtransactions. This is more than just a Marble Blast clone; need I say more?\n\nEDIT: TO WHOEVER OF YOU THREE DISLIKED THIS REVIEW, I WILL FIND YOU AND I WILL KILL YOU.

Game now supports steam controller, can use gyroscope motions for marble rolling action thankyou dev 10/10
